description: Ms. codex. Title from inscription in gold in headpiece (ʻunwān) on fol. 1b. Physical description: 9 lines per page. Written in medium large naskh (professional hand) in black ink with use of red (gold circles text-stops on fol. 1b). The text is framed within two red lines (gold outlined in black on fol. 1b-2a). Simply executed headpiece consisting of frames in gold outlined in black on fol. 1b. European paper. Collation: Paper, fol. i, 217, i ; i (fly-leaf) 1¹⁰ (-1 at beginning of quire) 2-21¹⁰ 22⁸ i (fly-leaf) ; catchword on the verso of each leaf. Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the upper cover: "Ḥ 157". Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the pastedown of the upper cover: "Ḥ 812". Origin: According to colophon, copy (taʻlīq) completed on 3 [Dhū] al-Ḥijjah 1061 [Nov. 17, 1651] by Ḥasan ibn ʻAlī (fol. 216a). Incipit: الحمد لله على جزيل نعمائه احمده على جزيل الآئه واشكره على جميل بلآئه واشهد ... [2أ] ... وبعد فقد رغب الى من وجب جوابه علىّ ان اجمع له مقتصرا على مذهب الامام ابى حنيفة النعمان Explicit: على شيء من التركة فاطرحه كان لم يكن على سهام الباقين والحمد لله وحده والصلاة والسلام ...
author: Ḥanafī, ʻAbd Allāh ibn Maḥmūd.
abstract: Elegant copy of a collection on fatwas according to the Ḥanafī school by Majd al-Dīn ʻAbd Allāh ibn Mawdūd al-Mawṣilī al-Buldajī, b. Mawṣil 599 or 609 H./1202 or 1212, qāḍī in Kūfa then Bagdad, where he died in 683/1284. The text is followed on fol. 216b by three short cases, apparently written by the same hand as the mian text.
extent: i, 217, i leaves: paper ; 207 x 147 (144 x 89) mm. bound to 208 x 158 mm.
title: Kitāb Mukhtār al-fatāwá ʻalá madhhab al-Imām al-aʻẓam.
provenance: Impression of an octogonal stamp on the lower outer corner of fol. 2a. Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.
creator: حنفي، عبد الله بن محمود
subject: Fatwas—13th century
binding note: Burgundy leather over paper pasteboards for upper and lower covers, fore-edge flap and envelope flap. The covers have a central blind stamped and gold-painted mandorla outlined in gold and an outer frame consisting on blind and gold fillets and a guilloche. Similar frame on the envelope flap, with a smaller blind stamped and gold painted pattern on its pointe. leather doublure.
member of collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
